sentence.Network_en: A cur barking at the sun cannot detract from its glory.
sentence.Network_cn: 狂犬吠日,无损于太阳的光辉.

sentence.Network_en: These revelations should not detract from his achievements.
sentence.Network_cn: 不应该因暴露出来的这些事而贬低他的成就.

sentence.Network_en: That does not detract from his merit.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 字根字尾构词法.doc - 豆丁网 ... deter 防止 detract 减损,责难 detrimental 有害,伤害的.
D字开头的英语单词 - 已解决 - 搜搜问问 ... 1.detest：v. 厌恶，讨厌 3.detract：v. 贬低，诋毁，减损 4.devastate：v. 摧毁，破坏，毁 …
LSAT红宝书1 - 豆丁网 ... deterrent 威慑 detract 转移 detractor 诽谤者,恶意批评者.
deter 防止detract 减损,责难detrimental 有害,伤害的

list.abs: Something that impairs or detracts from physical perfection ; a defect ., 缺陷身体完美状态上的损害或损伤 ; 缺陷.
That does not detract from how impressive Wang has been this season ., 但这并没有降低他这个球季是多麽的令人印象深刻.
大学综合英语教材2的单词表？ ... ... be involved in sth 与。。。。有关系，有牵连 detract from sth 使逊色 share in sth 分享；分担.
detract vi.削弱，贬低detract from 有损于，降低devastating adj.破坏性的，毁灭性的
testimony that only detracts from the strength of the plaintiff ' s case ., 仅仅降低了原告案情有力的证词.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin detract- 'drawn away', from the verb detrahere, from de- 'away from' + trahere 'draw'

entry.def: If one thing detracts from another, it makes it seem less good or impressive.

example.ex: The publicity could detract from our election campaign.
example.tran: 这些宣传报道可能会有损我们的竞选活动。

means.word_mean: 1. take away a part from; diminish;

sentences.sentence: "His bad manners detract from his good character"

auth_sentence.content: Though this doesn't detract from any of the larger points.
auth_sentence.res_content: Though this doesn't detract from any of the larger points.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Though this doesn't detract from any of the larger points.

auth_sentence.content: Belief in creation does detract from one's ability to do science.
auth_sentence.res_content: Belief in creation does detract from one's ability to do science.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Belief in creation does detract from one's ability to do science.

auth_sentence.content: Insignificant details can detract from an overview of our picture of the facts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Insignificant details can detract from an overview of our picture of the facts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Insignificant details can detract from an overview of our picture of the facts.

means.word_mean: 毁损, 贬低, 减损

sentences.en: The defect detracts greatly from the value of the vase.
sentences.cn: 这瑕疵大大地降低了花瓶的价值。

sentences.en: These revelations should not detract from his achievements.
sentences.cn: 不应该因暴露出来的这些事而贬低他的成就。

sentences.en: Her tattered clothes in no way detracted from her beauty.
sentences.cn: 她的破衣烂衫丝毫没有影响她的美貌。
